TopicTitle: My back wheels on my rover sink into the the ground on xbox one

Articles.Content: What can I do to stop it?

2 hours ago, Fearless leader said:

What can I do to stop it?

Are you sure you have them fitted the correct way up.  Unity/KSP wheels only work in one position,  if inverted or rotated from correct position then they display the condition you describe.
I remember I fitted them the correct way up, but all my other rovers drive fine except it. I even refitted the wheels, but it still does not work.

1 hour ago, Fearless leader said:

I remember I fitted them the correct way up, but all my other rovers drive fine except it. I even refitted the wheels, but it still does not work.

Hi what this will be is the wheel blocking mechanic, due to very unpleasant interactions between unity and KSP in the current version the wheels have been given a large safety area around, them, this is great until you want to mount the wheels in anything like a realistic way then you can find a situation in which the wheel is disabled,  I have no clue how you  console users check context menus' on pc it would be a right click on the part and a check to see if the wheel shows blocked.  The only way to fix it  is to move the wheels away from any overhanging  parts or parts that could come close to the wheel when the wheel is turned or moves on the suspension.
Can we see a screenshot of the craft in question?

I do not know how to share pictures on xbox and take screenshot for the xbox version of ksp. I will try to know how to do screenshots for it later.

Edit: cannot do it 

Edited September 8, 2016 by Fearless leader
I found that there was no way to take screenshots in the xbox version of ksp
